attributes.action: Install ANPR systems on the A2 junction with the A282.
attributes.background: Drivers bypass the A282 by using the A2 junction roundabout and then the A225 junction when the traffic is bad. This causes severe delays to Dartford residents going about their daily business. Drivers doing this show no consideration to other drivers and they should be fined for using this dodge.
attributes.additional_details: I live in DA1 and it once took 45 minutes to get to Asda Greenhithe because of this level of inconsiderate driving. Yesterday it accounted for nearly 20 minutes of delay because of HGV drivers blocking the A225 Princes Road junction with the roundabout. Local residents have the right to go about their daily business without the fear of being delayed by such inconsiderate drivers, who are only interested in themselves. Plus there are frequent law infringements on this roundabout.

attributes.action: Reduce the amount of time from 5 years to 3 for a divorce without consent.
attributes.background: You can divorce with their consent after 2 years separation but if they decide not to consent you then have to wait 5 years and you can divorce without their consent. 5 years is too long and more than double the 2 years with consent.

attributes.action: Impose a mandatory life sentence for acid attacks
attributes.background: The effects of vitriolage on a victim are lifelong, therefore a life sentence is the only fair way to deal with the perpetrator. Mandatory life sentences would also act as a deterrent, and reduce the number of such heinous attacks in London.

attributes.action: Grant leave to  undocumented Zimbabweans with at least 15years residence in UK
attributes.background: Since  at least 2000,  thousands of Zimbabwean citizens have fled the turbulent political, social and economic situation in Zimbabwe. A  significant number of Zimbabweans with at least 15years residence remain  here undocumented, despite perpetual gross human rights violations in Zimbabwe.
attributes.additional_details: The Zimbabwean government has brought its own citizens to their knees. The situation there is not getting any better. One only has to look at the news reports. Rather than expect a return to a country that is clearly "broken", there is  more humane, compassionate and tolerant action that the UK government can take. Grant leave to remain to undocumented Zimbabweans with at least 15years residence in the UK, further taking into account the best interests of their minor children born here.

attributes.action: Maternity pay to reflect your regular salary.
attributes.background: Maternity pay is the same for everyone regardless of their usual earnings. A part time colleague took her full maternity leave as her pay was similar to her usual salary. I feel discriminated as a higher earner as I will need to return to work early as I will lose £1200 per month on maternity pay.

attributes.action: Change Ofsted's investigation visits from scheduled to unannounced
attributes.background:
Due to a recent incident involving my child's nursery it has come to my attention that Ofsted give notice of an inspection to schools and nurseries. 
When it comes to the welfare of our children scheduled visits is not the most accurate way of obtaining information about a childcare provider

attributes.action: Driving licence: Introduce mandatory re-training/re-examination every 5-10y
attributes.background: Driving tech, laws, training & examination changes/improves, as such, we should introduce mandatory re-skilling/examination to ensure all drivers are up to par also allowing removal of drivers from the road whom would not meet modern driving skill/knowlege requirements to make our roads safer.
attributes.additional_details: We live in an age where someone could have passed their test 50 years ago, and not have any of the modern driving skills or knowledge that is imparted onto modern drivers, all drivers should have to be kept "up to skill" to ensure they are safe road users.

attributes.action: Introduce a trade embargo on Saudi Arabia
attributes.background: The Saudi state is notorious for its unjust and frankly disgusting treatment of women and LGBT people. It also massively restricts the civil liberties of its entire population. There is also evidence that suggests Saudi donors sponsor terrorism. We cannot support governments of this sort.
attributes.additional_details:
From gov.uk: 
"It’s illegal for women to drive."
"Homosexual acts and extra-marital sexual relations, including adultery, are illegal and can be subject to severe penalties."
"The Saudi legal system differs in many ways from the UK. Suspects can be held without charge"

A series of leaks from the then-Secretary of State Hillary Clinton's emails suggested that Saudi donors fund extremism.
A number of mosques found to be preaching extremist Wahhabism have been said to be linked to Saudi organisations.

attributes.action: Prevent the current changes to pharmacy regulations being debated by the DoH
attributes.background: The planned changes to pharmacy regulations aim to allow a pharmacy to open and allow prescription-only medicines to be given out without a Responsible Pharmacist present. This will inevitably result in both patient harm and reduced access to pharmacy services for patients.
attributes.additional_details: The government has said that they wish to "better utilise the skills of pharmacists in healthcare settings such as hospitals and GP practices", but have put no proposals forward to guarantee jobs for the many community pharmacists and Locums that this will put out of work. People who have been at the heart of the community helping patients will now find themselves without work, and those patients will find they have reduced access to pharmacy services.

attributes.action: To stop lorries/buses overtaking on A roads and Motorways to reduce congestion.
attributes.background: The main problem on motorways is congestions and crashes. The problem is lorries are trying to overtake each other which takes too long which means the flow of traffic slows and causes congestion and crashes. It would stop the middle lane slowing which makes more cars stay in the middle lane.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/speed-limits

Above are the speed limits of vehicles over 7.5 tonnes to 60 mph which is 10 mph slower than the motorway speed.

attributes.action: Increase efficiency of motorways by permitting overtaking on the left.
attributes.background: The UK motorway network is one of the most congested in Europe. The UK government are spending £ millions implementing "smart motorways" to help increase efficiency. The problem is NOT just volume of traffic, but because motorists don't abide by Highway code rule 264 leading to 'empty lanes'.
attributes.additional_details: Penalties to motorists ignoring rule 264 (keeping in the left lane unless overtaking) were introduced, but the decrease in motorway police patrols means this rarely enforced. Many motorists still habitually drive in Lane 2 while Lane 1 is empty;this forces all faster moving traffic into Lane 3 so becomes full 'nose to tail' and motorways operate below optimum capacity. By allowing overtaking on the left (as the USA) ALL lanes of motorways would be fully utilised to increase capacity at no cost.

attributes.action: Legislate that cyclists & bicycles are tested, taxed, insured and registered.
attributes.background: The government must legislate to bring cyclists in line with other public road users. Therefore, cyclists should pay for and take a competency test, be issued with a license, be issued with two registration numbered Hi-Viz jackets, be insured and pay road tax.
attributes.additional_details: Following a recent death involving a bicycle, cyclist deaths caused by lack of awareness and continuing reports in the media of cyclists contravening red lights and pedestrian crossings, we must bring cycles under control and bring in a regime of culpability. If you want to cycle on public roads you should behave by and be governed by the rules and regulations of the road and you should pay for that priviledge, just as other road users have to.

attributes.action: Stop oversized and hazardous goods vehicles using the Dartford Tunnel
attributes.background: We’re a logistics business headquartered in Dartford and we’ve officially had enough of the Dartford traffic jam. Our simple solution: Stop oversized & hazardous goods vehicles using the Dartford Tunnel.
attributes.additional_details:
We propose a simple solution: Stop the Convoys and get Dartford moving. Traffic at the Dartford Tunnel is brought to a standstill on average 100 times a day by a small number of oversized & hazardous goods vehicles which need to be escorted through the tunnel, in a convoy. 
Each convoy can take up to 2.5 mins to travel through the tunnel, and a tunnel is closed around every 15 mins. 
Why should 99% of drivers suffer due to less than 1% of vehicles? 
Our suggestion is simple: Stop these oversized/hazardous vehicles using the tunnel & send them the other way around the M25.

attributes.action: Allow everyone over 55 flexibility to manage their private pension
attributes.background: The Pension Schemes Act 2015 allowed individuals from the age of 55 to be able to access their pension flexibility if they wish, but not if you had already accessed your pension prior to the new Act coming into force. I want this Government to give us the same rights to manage our pension as we wish

attributes.action: Affordable homes: amend law on new builds, compulsory purchases & shared schemes
attributes.background: Current law allows developers to build unaffordable homes (£175-£200k more for an area) on communal lands and on homes taken by compulsory purchases. Displaced residents are given less money than needed to relocate locally. Developers are still able to own sold homes via shared ownership schemes.
attributes.additional_details:
Change the rules of compulsory purchases to ensure displaced residents get replacement values (not market value) plus 10%
 
Require homes built on communal land or compulsory purchased homes to be no more than 110% of the market value for older homes.
 
Ban shared ownership schemes if the price is more than 110% of the market value of older properties. New build homes are escalating housing inflation with their pricing which is underpinned by shared ownership schemes.

attributes.action: Strict Law on purchase of Acid
attributes.background: Increase in number of acid attacks everyday. It is very disappointing to know the easy availability of acid. It is not the face or body they destroy, they destroy the whole life of the victims. Acid should only be available to license holders.
attributes.additional_details: Acid attacks in London are increasing everyday. People have started attacking in groups now. It is very scary to walk in the street of London. It has to stop now! Acid should only be available to license holders and strict law should be enforced on each and every purchase of the substance. Lets make London a terror free place to live again!!

attributes.action: Make Eid a national holiday
attributes.background: Muslims believe that Eid should be a national holiday as it is a religious celebration similar to Christmas. Many people believe this from Muslims to even none Muslims.

attributes.action: Expedite legislation guaranteeing the right to vote for UK citizens for life.
attributes.background: UK citizens residing outside the UK lose the right to vote in UK elections and referenda after 15 years as an overseas elector. The government had said it would introduce legislation to change this, giving the right to vote for life. That legislation should be introduced within the next 6 months.

attributes.action: Police required by law to pursue suspects not wearing a helmet
attributes.background: Every day there is more and more crime on motorbikes/mopeds etc. If the people riding them aren’t wearing a helmet, they know that the police cannot pursue them. They are laughing and getting away with it. Enough is enough. If they're big enough to do the crime, they're big enough to take the risk.

attributes.action: Scrap the OISC and extend the remit of the SRA to Immigration Advisers
attributes.background: The Office of Immigration Services Commissioner (OISC) is sponsored by the Home Office and regulates immigration advisers, professionals that do an important job and many are more specialised than solicitors. I believe the OISC operates in a secretive, undemocratic, biased and unfair manner.
attributes.additional_details:
It's powers are hardly challenged as it has many powers.

The fact this body quietly operates with professionals that do not have much legal knowledge can leave professionals open to unfair treatment. Surprisingly they almost always win cases in court. This cannot be right. The Home Office itself with much more infrastructure does not have this level of precision.
